ayas.translation: Nun. By the pen and that which they write (therewith),
ayas.transliteration: nūn ۚ wal qalami wa mā yasṭurūn

bismillah.translation: In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.

ayas.translation: Thou art not, for thy Lord's favour unto thee, a madman.
And lo! thine verily will be a reward unfailing.
ayas.transliteration: wa inna laka la-ajran ghayra mamnūn

ayas.translation: And lo! thou art of a tremendous nature.
And thou wilt see and they will see
Which of you is the demented.

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ
ayas.translation: Lo! thy Lord is Best Aware of him who strayeth from His way, and He is Best Aware of those who walk aright.
ayas.transliteration: inna rabbaka huwa a`lamu biman ḍalla `an sabīlihi wahuwa a`lamu bil muhtadīn

ayas.translation: Therefor obey not thou the rejecters
Who would have had thee compromise, that they may compromise.
Neither obey thou each feeble oath-monger,
Detracter, spreader abroad of slanders,
Hinderer of the good, transgressor, malefactor
Greedy therewithal, intrusive.
It is because he is possessed of wealth and children

ayas.arabic: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
ayas.translation: That, when Our revelations are recited unto him, he saith: Mere fables of the men of old.
We shall brand him on the nose.

ayas.arabic: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَـٰهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَآ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا۟ لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ
ayas.translation: Lo! We have tried them as We tried the owners of the garden when they vowed that they would pluck its fruit next morning,
ayas.transliteration: innā balawnāhum kamā balawnā aṣ-ḥābal jannati idh aqsamū layaṣrimunnahā muṣbiḥīn

ayas.translation: And made no exception (for the Will of Allah);

ayas.arabic: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَآئِفٌ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَآئِمُونَ
ayas.translation: Then a visitation from thy Lord came upon it while they slept
ayas.transliteration: faṭāfa `alayhā ṭā-ifun min rabbika wahum nā-imūn

ayas.translation: And in the morning it was as if plucked.
And they cried out one unto another in the morning,

ayas.arabic: أَنِ ٱغْدُوا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰرِمِينَ
ayas.translation: Saying: Run unto your field if ye would pluck (the fruit).
So they went off, saying one unto another in low tones:

ayas.arabic: أَن لَّا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا ٱلْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُم مِّسْكِينٌ
ayas.translation: No needy man shall enter it to-day against you.
They went betimes, strong in (this) purpose.
But when they saw it, they said: Lo! we are in error!
Nay, but we are desolate!

ayas.arabic: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
ayas.translation: The best among them said: Said I not unto you: Why glorify ye not (Allah)?
ayas.transliteration: qāla awsaṭuhum alam aqul lakum lawlā tusabbiḥūn

ayas.arabic: قَالُوا۟ سُبْحَـٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ
ayas.translation: They said: Glorified be our Lord! Lo! we have been wrong-doers.
ayas.transliteration: qālū subḥāna rabbinā innā kunnā ẓālimīn

ayas.translation: Then some of them drew near unto others, self-reproaching.
They said: Alas for us! In truth we were outrageous.

ayas.arabic: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهَآ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَٰغِبُونَ
ayas.translation: It may be that our Lord will give us better than this in place thereof. Lo! we beseech our Lord.
ayas.transliteration: `asā rabbunā an yubdilanā khayran minhā innā ilā rabbinā rāghibūn

ayas.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
ayas.translation: Such was the punishment. And verily the punishment of the Hereafter is greater if they did but know.
ayas.transliteration: kadhālikal `adhāb ۖ wala`adhābul-ākhirati akbar ۚ law kānū ya`lamūn

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّـٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
ayas.translation: Lo! for those who keep from evil are gardens of bliss with their Lord.
Shall We then treat those who have surrendered as We treat the guilty?
What aileth you? How foolishly ye judge!
Or have ye a scripture wherein ye learn
That ye shall indeed have all that ye choose?

ayas.arabic: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَـٰنٌ عَلَيْنَا بَـٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۙ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ
ayas.translation: Or have ye a covenant on oath from Us that reacheth to the Day of Judgment, that yours shall be all that ye ordain?
ayas.transliteration: am lakum aymānun `alaynā bālighatun ilā yawmil qiyāmati inna lakum lamā taḥkumūn

ayas.translation: Ask them (O Muhammad) which of them will vouch for that!

ayas.arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَآءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا۟ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمْ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَـٰدِقِينَ
ayas.translation: Or have they other gods? Then let them bring their other gods if they are truthful
ayas.transliteration: am lahum shurakā-u falya-tū bishurakā-ihim in kānū ṣādiqīn

ayas.arabic: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَن سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
ayas.translation: On the day when it befalleth in earnest, and they are ordered to prostrate themselves but are not able,
ayas.transliteration: yawma yukshafu `an sāqin wayud`awna ilas sujūdi falā yastaṭī`ūn

ayas.arabic: خَـٰشِعَةً أَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۖ وَقَدْ كَانُوا۟ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَـٰلِمُونَ
ayas.translation: With eyes downcast, abasement stupefying them. And they had been summoned to prostrate themselves while they were yet unhurt.
ayas.transliteration: khāshi`atan abṣāruhum tarhaquhum dhillah ۖ waqad kānū yud`awna ilas sujūdi wahum sālimūn

ayas.arabic: فَذَرْنِى وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ ۖ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
ayas.translation: Leave Me (to deal) with those who give the lie to this pronouncement. We shall lead them on by steps from whence they know not.
ayas.transliteration: fadharnī wa man yukadhhibu bihādhal ḥadīth ۖ sanastadrijuhum min ḥaythu lā ya`lamūn

ayas.translation: Yet I bear with them, for lo! My scheme is firm.

ayas.arabic: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ
ayas.translation: Or dost thou (Muhammad) ask a fee from them so that they are heavily taxed?
ayas.transliteration: am tas-aluhum ajran fahum min maghramin muthqalūn

ayas.translation: Or is the Unseen theirs that they can write (thereof)?

ayas.arabic: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ
ayas.translation: But wait thou for thy Lord's decree, and be not like him of the fish, who cried out in despair.
ayas.transliteration: faṣbir liḥukmi rabbika walā takun kaṣāḥibil ḥūti idh nādā wahuwa makẓūm

ayas.arabic: لَّوْلَآ أَن تَدَٰرَكَهُۥ نِعْمَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلْعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ
ayas.translation: Had it not been that favour from his Lord had reached him he surely had been cast into the wilderness while he was reprobate.
ayas.transliteration: lawlā an tadārakahu ni`matun min rabbihi lanubidha bil `arā-i wahuwa madhmūm

ayas.translation: But his Lord chose him and placed him among the righteous.

ayas.arabic: وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَـٰرِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا۟ ٱلذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجْنُونٌ
ayas.translation: And lo! those who disbelieve would fain disconcert thee with their eyes when they hear the Reminder, and they say: Lo! he is indeed mad;
ayas.transliteration: wa in yakādul ladhīna kafarū layuzliqūnaka bi-abṣārihim lammā sami`udh dhikra wayaqūlūna innahu lamajnūn

ayas.translation: When it is naught else than a Reminder to creation.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā huwa illā dhikrul lil`ālamīn
